page.title: 11Living with nature.
page.content: {An interview with a local resident.} I have lived in Stansted for over 67 years,moving here just after the war.I met my husband here.He worked for the local nursery all his life where they used to grow grapes,tomatoes and some flowers.The nursery supplied{Covent {Garden}in{London. I helped my husband to carefully pick the tomatoes,an important job as they had to be{'just on the turn',}not too green and not too ripe. In 1930 the nursery employed 175 workers,but work declined as the years went by and in 1975 the nursery closed down.Now the nursery is owned by an Italian family and they run just a few greenhouses for growing tomatoes, cucumbers and some flowers. My husband worked very hard for his living and he died some 8 years ago. I now live with my daughter.
